metadata.title: CVE-2017-7435 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In libzypp before 20170803 it was possible to add unsigned YUM repositorieswithout warning to the user that could lead to man in the middle ormalicious servers to inject malicious RPM packages into a users system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7435` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzypp-bin - 17.6.1-1
libzypp-common - 17.6.1-1
libzypp-config - 17.6.1-1
libzypp1702 - 17.6.1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libzypp package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '17.6.1-1').
